21001.name: Alibi Saknas: Herrgårdsmordet
21001.description:
In this game you are taken back to 1955 on an estate where six characters live. On this god-forsaken day one of them will be murdered. The way you and your opponents play your cards will build up the characters, reveal clues and unfold the mystery. Finally the murderer will be accused. You will build plots around your opponents and try to give your character an innocent appearance - because you are all Without Alibi!

Only available in Swedish so far.

21002.description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.
21002.name: Think: Logik Trainer

21004.description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.
21004.name: Think: Traveller's

21005.name: Scaredy Cat
21005.description:
"Piece together the scarecrow, collect and count the birds but watch out for the scaredy cat."

Scaredy Cat is a children's game for two to six players Ages 5 - 10. The object of the game is to collect cards with birds on them. the winner is the player who has the most birds when the game ends.

To set up the game, all the cards are shuffled together and placed face down on the table. Players take it in turns to draw a card

There are three types of cards in the deck:

Most of the cards in the deck are Bird cards which have a picture of one to six birds on them. When a Bird card is drawn, the player puts it on the table in front of them.

Scaredy Cat cards have a picture of a cat on them. When one of the three scaredy cat cards are drawn, the player who drew it loses all of their bird cards. The bird cards are shuffled back into the deck along with the scaredy cat card.

The six Scarecrow cards each have a different part of a picture of a scarecrow on them. When one is drawn, it is placed in the middle of the table. When all six pieces are on the table, and the scarecrow is complete, the game ends and the birds are counted.

At the end of the game the birds on all the bird cards on the table are counted, the player with the most birds wins.

We have found that the game works best with three or more players. Two player games tend to go on for a long time with much frustration.

21006.name: The Wonderful Wizard Of Oz Spinner Game
21006.description:
The Wonderful Wizard Of Oz Spinner Game, 1975 from The Toy Factory.

Simple spinner game for Ages 5 - 12. The spinner is integrated to the middle of the gameboard.

Spin and move the indicated number of spaces. Follow directions there, if any. The first player to reach the Emerald City wins.

Includes 4 character cardboard pawns on stands.

21007.description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.
21007.name: Think: Memo Story

21008.description:
To be the first player to fill the five slots on his color section of the playing board.

Contents: Game board with attached spinner, letter cards, instructions (inside box lid).
21008.name: Spin 'n Win

21009.name: Limbo Legs
21009.description: Be nimble, be quick, jump over the limbo stick! The game is an elimination contest. Players jump over the revolving limbo stick while performing a task (determined by spinning the large Twister-esque spinner). If any player fails to clear the limbo stick, they are eliminated from the game.

21010.name: The Life of Christ: A Christian Bible Game
21010.description:
From the box:
"Children and adults will love learning about the life of Jesus Christ through this beautifully illustrated and exciting board game. This inspired board game is framed in the Bible's chronological, geographic and historical context, and features multiple-choice questions about the birth, life, death and resurrection of Jesus Christ."

If players answer a multiple-choice question correctly, they may advance their token one space on the game board. The player to reach the end of the board first wins.

21011.description:
Description from publisher:

A word spelling game.
A beautifully illustrate, multi colored board game, scientifically made to help children learn spellings of 560 carefully selected words which make up a 2/3 of the vocabulary of everyday usage.
Players compete in this exciting game to spell the words correctly and race along the path on the board to score the maximum marks.

An enjoyable and challenging game that would go a long way to test, correct and reinforce the knowledge of spellings of a child. He/she would be able to learn the spelling of 560 selected basic words which are commonly misspelled.
21011.name: Speller Junior

21012.description:
A four-player version of Pentago. (Now in color, instead of black and white)
An abstract strategy game with nine 3×3 grids arranged into a larger 9x9 grid. Players alternate placing marbles on the board, each players has a color of marbles, and the game is set-up to allow team-play. The first player or team to get five in a row on the entire 9x9 grid wins, but there is a twist: Every time a player places a marble he or she also turns any one of the game’s eight outer boards (3×3 grid) 90° in either direction. The ever-changing game board makes the game all the more challenging.

Re-implements:

Pentago




Re-implemented by:

Multiplayer Pentago
21012.name: Pentago XL

21013.name: Plic-Plac Pirates
21013.description:
A plic-plac is a couple of cards which have the same pattern or the same color. This makes combinations in several ways.
Players have to locate and pocket the maximum of plic-plac.
Other players can react by cutting plic-placs. If a player fails to do a plic-plac, then he gives information to other players and makes its plic-plac vulnerable.

21015.description:
Flower Power is a limited edition version of Jungle Speed. Available in French only and presenting new cards even crazier than the previous expansion (3 new special cards and new shapes).

The game comes in a tin box in a shape of a VW MiniBus from the 70's and the totem is a plastic stool.
21015.name: Jungle Speed Flower Power

21016.name: Termitenspiel
21016.description: 64 (4 sets of 16) small cardboard cubes with termite trails, all in a canvas bag. Rules for 6 games are included.

21017.description: An LPS bonus mini-game, On To Berlin is a 2-player game tactical / operational simulation of the hypothetical last battle of WW2, code-named Operation Eclipse. This is a variant of Fortress Berlin that assumes the Allies launched an airborne assault (3 US and 3 British divisions) on Berlin in March 1945. On To Berlin is not a complete game by itself as it requires ownership of Fortress Berlin.
21017.name: On to Berlin

21018.name: Chariots
21018.description: This is a game for a standard piecepack about racing chariots, like in the Circus Maximus in ancient Rome. The game uses a plotted impulse based movement system similar to that in the game Star Fleet Battles or Car Wars. This game is about racing, not combat.

21019.name: RIFF
21019.description:
A smart DVD trivia game for music fans. Very creative ways of presenting the questions. Great to play with a bunch of friends. There's a game called Battle of the Bands which pits the two teams against each other head to head.

All the questions were new, nothing repeated unlike some other DVD games, and it was really easy to play.

21020.name: Domina
21020.description:
Domina is a traversal game by noted New Zealand game and puzzle designer Karl Scherer. The object is to get one of your pieces to the opposite end of the board before your opponent does the same.

The board is an 8x8 square grid, and the pieces are rectangles in two colors, seven for each player, each spanning two square spaces. Dominos in two colors on a standard Checker board work well. On a turn, a player pins one end of any of his/her pieces, then rotates it 90° clockwise. If, and only if, that would cause the rotating end of the piece to occupy a space that is either already filled, off the board or behind the pivot end of the piece, continue rotating the piece another 90° to 180°. Likewise, continue rotating another 90° to 270° if the next target space is unavailable or illegal. If none of the three target spaces make a legal move, the player must select a different piece to move. The first to land one end of a piece on the opposite row wins.

21021.name: Ohne Worte!
21021.description: Players try to form words by playing a letter-card and using (at least) all the letters already on the table and the one just played. If anybody fails he has to take all the cards played so far and he starts a new word. After all cards have been played the player with the least cards taken wins.

21022.name: Objets Trouvés
21022.description:
Description of game by Bruno Faidutti:

So we had a pebble, a tooth brush, a fork, a lighter, a toy soldier, a die and two or three other items, and each player in turn had to use them to have the other guess an answer in a list of five such as Snow White and the seven Dwarves, the Sleeping Beauty, Little Red Riding Hood, The Brave Little Tailor, Cinderella. Like with some other games of the kind, such as the fantastic Wat und Dat, you don't believe it will work - and it works wonderfully.

21023.name: Il pranzo è servito
21023.description: Game based on the old, popular Italian TV Show "Il pranzo è servito".

21024.description:
This version of Sudoku comes with a DVD. The tiles are double-sided: one side has traditional numbers, the other side has symbols for slightly different experience.

Place the board in the middle of the table. The board shows an empty Sudoku puzzle. In the box there are the numbered tiles.

Start the DVD an choose from the menu which variant you want to play.
In the classic mode, the screen shows the startposition. Or you can choose a variant where only the numbers 1 to 9 are placed once.
When it's your turn, push 'enter' on the remote control, place a tile, and push 'menu'. The other players can comment your placement. If the active player placed a tile on the wrong place, he/she gets penalty time. The turn is moved to the next player.

When a puzzle is solved (or cannot be solved any futher) choose çup' from the menu. All the players can see what their time is. The fastest player wins the game.

The other side of the tiles can be used to play with different colors instead of numbers. There are also chips included. When the timer reaches 30 minutes, it starts over from zero. To remind the players that half a hour is passed they can use the chips.
21024.name: DVD Sudoku

21025.name: Hexade
21025.description:
This game is played with the same set of Havannah (another game by Christian Freeling): an hexagonal board (size 8) and two sets of stones.

Players take turns placing a stone of their color on the board.
Goal of the game is forming "a perfect six", which means creating:

six stones in a straight row, or
six stones in a compact triangle, or
six stones in a small hexagon.




Captures are possible: you can capture two adjacent opponent's stones sandwiching them between two of your stones.

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

21026.name: Pindoo
21026.description:
An abstract strategy board game for 2 to 6 players.
Taking turns and using dice, players must move their Pindoos (pieces) to the opposite side of the board before the opponent(s).

21027.description:
Thirteen cards are placed on designated areas on the game board’s track. Each player, in turn, rolls the die and moves one’s pawn along the track. Whenever a player’s pawn lands on a card, the player takes the card. Most cards have a value of 1, 2, 3 or 4. The object of the game is to collect cards totaling twelve. Cards that have a drawing of Mighty Mouse, of which there are eight, allow a player to move backwards.

This is seemingly a different game from Mighty Mouse Game
21027.name: Terrytoons Mighty Mouse Game

21028.name: Captain Gallant
21028.description:
This antique game is based on the TV show Captain Gallant of the Foreign Legion. The TV show featured the well-known LARRY "BUSTER" CRABBE, who played Captain Michael Gallant. He is better known for his roles as TARZAN, FLASH GORDON and BUCK RODGERS

Game includes:
16 mounted riders in four colors;
Game board;
Dice and dice holder; and
Plastic position indicator.

In addition to the game, one can find add-ons in plain packaging: things such as Trees, Ferns, and Camels produced by Marx.

21029.name: Satellite Shoot
21029.description:
This game has the same mechanics as the classic Battleship game, but it's the "Space Travel" version.

The board is separated by a cardboard stand-up divider, and the cardboard spaceship counters are placed on the board in the same way as Battleship.

Some very nice retro 60's artwork on the cover and board divider.

21030.description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to China and South America.

Steam Brothers started to design expansions mainly for fun and adding re-playability to this great game. Now, with the help of John Bohrer from Winsome Games, we can share our pleasure with all the Age of Steam fans.

With this expansion, you’ll experience new great action such as Diplomatic Pressure in China and El Presidente for the South America.

Halfway reimplemented by:

Age of Steam Expansion: South America / South Africa
21030.name: Age of Steam Expansion: China / South America

21031.description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to South Africa and Northeastern USA. Steam Brothers strikes again with two other maps for the great Age of Steam. Now, you can exploit the awesome resources of South Africa just like the golden age of Klondike and speculate in the Northeastern USA.

Halfway reimplemented by:

Age of Steam Expansion: South America / South Africa
21031.name: Age of Steam Expansion: North Eastern USA / South Africa

21032.name: The Wild-Flower Game
21032.description:
From the box:
This game was developed to help you get to know and recognize some of the wild flowers that can be seen in Britain during the Spring and Summer. It should also make you aware that the future of even some quite familiar plants is now anything but secure in the wild.

Game Synopsis:
Roll the die and move along a numbered circular track. Gain points for landing on a colored circle; double them if you identify the associated wild flower. There are 'chance' cards, giving you extra points for answering wild-flower based questions.

21033.name: Innamoramento e Amore
21033.description:
A game from Francesco Alberoni's Book.
This game explores human interaction from falling in love to marriage and betrayal..

21034.name: lamafia
21034.description:
Sicily, 1943. Main Mafia families in Western Sicily, supported by the Allies who have overthrown Fascism, took back the control of rural areas inside the country.

Up to 6 powerful Mafia families struggle to achieve the economical and political power in Sicily and Italy, managing their deals with the Italian-American gangsters and with the South American and Far East drug traffickers.
They accumulate their fortunes through the typical ways of organized crime, then re-invest their revenues in money laundering, in order to get some affiliates among the entrepreneurs and politicians.
The aim is to increase their prestige inside the organized crime structure, killing their opponents and dealing with the reaction of the State, always adapting their income sources to the evolution of the political context, through the enitre 50 years of Italian history depicted by the game.

The game can be FREELY downloaded for print, cut & play at:

www.calvinuslab.tk

Italian version is the only one currently available. English version coming soon.

21035.name: Baseball
21035.description:
Baseball - a Parker Brothers game - has some unusual components for its age. (There are three copyright dates; 1949 on the cards, 1950 on the rules and 1959 on the box.) There is a 3D score board plus a simple mechanism to compare the batter and pitcher's play choices. The results vary according to the plays and the rules cover Strikes, Walks, Outs, Runs and Stealing.

A deck of special cards cover certain situations.

This game is about out-guessing your opponents!

21036.name: Stratego: Star Wars Saga Edition
21036.description:
This game is very similar to the earlier Star Wars Stratego game. Unlike that game, however, this one includes characters not just from Episodes I, II, and IV-VI, but from Episode III as well.
There are 4 ways to play the game, each with slightly different rules - there is 1)Classic Stratego - The Star Wars Saga, which uses the traditional Stratego rules; 2) The Star Wars Saga with Special Powers, which is the same game but with special abilities granted to certain characters; 3) The Rise of the Empire - Episodes I, II, and III, which uses only the pieces from the first three episodes and in which the Anakin piece will switch sides from the Good to the Bad and, after being captured by the Good Army, gets to be replaced by the Darth Vader piece (special powers are used in this game and the board space is reduced); 4) The Rebellion - Episodes IV, V, and VI', which uses only pieces from the last three episodes along with all the special powers and reduced board space.
Included are 40 white pieces for the Good Army and 40 gray pieces for the Bad Army, the rule set, display tray and board.

21037.name: Quizmo Phonetic
21037.description: A bingo type game that can be used to help teach phonetics and reading.

21038.name: Divine Power
21038.description:
Who will be the first Archangel to take seat on God´s right hand or Arch-demon to sit down beside Satan?
You are a divine being with the free will to serve God or Satan. You are leading your minions of demons or angels on an ancient map from biblical times. Allie your self with players of the same faith or cross over to the other side and stab them in the back. Become the mightiest Archangel/demon and rule the world together with your Master.

21039.description: Your Don has no idea about horse racing, but he owns a horse. It´s your task to bring it in first. If you fail you have another option to make some money: Betting on the other horses and make a lot of money.
21039.name: Long Shot

21040.description:
Waterloo: Fate of France depicts Napoleon's climactic battle against the Allied armies gathered at Waterloo, June 16 through June 19, 1815. This is a beautiful game printed on high quality paper throughout.

Contents:
• Standard L2 Design Group game box 12" x 15" x 1.5"
• 24x36" Heavy board, one piece map
• 2 die cut counter sheets, 5/8" counters
• 1 deck of tactical cards
• 12 battle board maps
• 1 CRT (Combat Results Table)
• 1 TEC (Terrain Effects Chart)
• 1 Blue die, 1 Red die, 1 Green die
• Rules Book
• Scenario Book

Brief description:

The area map runs from one area south of Charleroi to Brussels and from one area west of Nivelles to one area east of Wavre.

The units are 5/8" counters. Types include infantry, cavalry, artillery, horse artillery, and leaders. Sizes are divisions and brigades with step reduction.

There are 12 tactical battle maps. The 6 named maps are: Quatre Bras, Sombreffe, Genappe, Wavre, Waterloo, and Brussels. The 6 generic terrain maps are: Forest, Woods, Town, Road/Wooded, Clear, and River.

There are three one battle map scenarios: Quatre Bras (an introductory scenario that can be played in 60-90 minutes), Ligny (2-3 hours), and Mont St. Jean (3-4 hours).

The Campaign game runs from the morning of June 16 to the afternoon of June 19. There are three 5 hour day turns and one night turn per calendar day.
21040.name: Waterloo: The Fate of France

21042.name: Twisted Tales
21042.description:
Created by a 7 year-old girl (now she would be 16!; is this the start to a game designer's resume?), this is a story telling game where you take familiar characters and twist the stories, so Handel and Gretel blew the pigs straw house down. The game consists of character and story cards.

Suitable for Ages 4 and up.

21043.name: Falling into a Black Hole: A Space VLBI Intergalactic Adventure
21043.description:
From NASA's site for kids:

you can take an imaginary trip to a black hole right now!

You will also visit such interesting places as a giant array of radio telescopes in the New Mexico desert and NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California. Then you will blast into space and visit the Earth-orbiting Japanese VSOP Radio Telescope (launched in 1997) and Russia's RadioAstron telescope (not yet launched).

Then you will leave Earth orbit and go on to explore other galaxies, an interstellar gas cloud, a neutron star, and finally, a black hole! You will earn "Antigravity Tokens" along the way, so that you will be able to escape from the black hole's tremendous gravitational force.

Object of the game:

Be the first to reach the Black Hole armed with at least 25 Antigravity Tokens so that you will be able to get yourself out and go home after you are through exploring.

Game available at - http://spaceplace.nasa.gov/en/kids/svlbi_do1.shtml

21044.name: Itsy Bitsy Spider Game
21044.description:
"The exciting game of Itsy Bitsy Spider's adventure!"

Itsy Bitsy Spider Game is a children's game for two to four players Ages 4 and up.

The main board of the game is a spiderweb angled at 45 degrees with a tap (faucet) at the top which, when turned, releases a small blue ball. Playing pieces are small spiders which slot into the board. Movement is determined by a twister-style spinner.

To begin, each player takes one of the spiders and, in turn, spins the spinner. The player may spin up:
- 2,3,4 or 5: the spider moves that number of spaces up the board;
- "switch spiders": the player may change places with another spider higher up on the board; or
- "turn the tap": the player turns the tap at the top of the spiderweb, releasing one of the blue balls.

The objective of the game is to move your spider up the spiderweb to the top. During the game, the tap may be turned, the ball released has a fairly good chance of hitting some of the spider playing pieces and knocking them off the spiderweb. Spiders which are knocked off have to start again at the bottom. The winner is the first player to reach the top.

21045.name: Smarte Penger
21045.description: The players try to get control in actual Norwegian companies. Most of the shares in the companies are sold in open or sealed auctions.

21046.description:
A boxed expansion for Die Siedler von Catan (The Settlers of Catan) which collects and revises previously released small expansions and adds a few new ones. It was bundled free with the 10th anniversary gold box version of Settlers.

The expansions are:

Atlantis
Catan: Event Cards (Events on Catan)
Im Dschungel (The Jungle),
Vulkane auf Catan (Volcano on Catan)
Die Spezialisten (The Specialists)
Die Stadtmauern (The City Walls)
Burgen auf Catan (Castles on Catan)
Der Grosse Fluss (The Great River),
Der Hafenmeister (The Harbourmaster)
Die Magische 7 (The Magic 7)




Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands:

Die Siedler von Catan (The Settlers of Catan)
21046.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Atlantis – Szenarien & Varianten

21047.name: Strat-O-Sphere
21047.description:
David Royffe's first game, which later evolved into his Pylos.

With four players, each player has 23 spheres (marbles). The spheres are used to build a pyramid layer by layer on a central grid. In rotation, each player adds a sphere to form a chain of their color. When a layer is complete the next player starts a new chain on the next layer up. Each sphere is now supported by four spheres below, one or more of which must be of the same color. If a player is blocked they must fill all the empty places in that layer. However there is an option to sacrifice a sphere into the tomb. The player who places the final sphere at the top of the pyramid wins.

There is a puzzle version for one. With two players, each player plays with 46 spheres in two colors.

21049.description:
"O my dear, what a mess!", mother burst out while clapping her hands over her head. She has just entered the children's room. Laura and her younger brother Tommy have been playing all day and their toys are scattered across the little room. They must tidy the room before they go to bed, but it is already beginning to get dark. Will the children be able to finish and be in bed before Laura's star is twinkling in the sky?

Laura's Star Game is about playing - hearing - feeling - reading!

The 12 Displays form the entire room of Laura's as a 6×2 picture. Each display has two empty slots for a couple of almost identical items like cars, airplanes, hand mirrors, flashlights, rubber ducks and slippers.

These items are placed inside a bag that has two separate pockets, and each pocket will contain one of each item plus either the dog or the bear. The 7 pieces of the Sun is assembled to form a clever timer: it has a central star-shaped part plus 5 pieces, each with 3 beams filling out the slots between the arms of the star. Finally is a cloud piece covering the sun when the game begins.

A player will stick a hand into each pocket of the bag, trying to identify two identical shapes without looking. This is much harder than it seems since the pieces have nicely rounded edges that makes them feel somewhat like each other, and even adults will find it difficult. It is however good training of the motor skills - especially for the wrong hand!

When the player is confident that two identical pieces have been found are the two pieces simultaneously retracted: If identical have the player succeed and the pieces are placed in the corresponding display and placed in front of the player.

Should the two pieces turn out not to be identical are they returned to the same pockets they were drawn from, and a piece of the Sun puzzle is removed. When only the central part of the sun remains will it be flipped over the next time a player fails, thus showing the star of the story. It's bedtime, the game is over and all the players lost because they didn't make the room tidy in time.

If the players manage to make the room in time, that is when the only tiles left in the bag are the dog and the bear, will the winner the player with most displays in front of her.
21049.name: Lauras Sternenspiel

boardgamehonor.21311: 2006 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Nominee

21050.description:
Combat Commander: Europe is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the European Theater of World War II. One player takes the role of the Axis (Germany) while another player commands the Allies (America or Russia). These two players will take turns playing one or more “Fate” cards from their hands in order to activate his units on the mapboard for various military functions.

Players attempt to achieve victory by moving their combat units across the game map to attack their opponent’s combat units and occupy as many objectives as possible. The degree to which a player succeeds or fails is measured by a scenario’s specific “Objective” chits, the destruction of enemy units, and the exiting of friendly units off the opponent’s board edge.

A game of Combat Commander is divided into several measures of Game Time. There is no sequence of play to follow, however: each Time segment is divided into a variable number of Player Turns, each of which may consist of one or more Fate Card "Orders" conducted by the active player. Fate Card "Actions" may generally be conducted by either player at any time. "Events" — both good and bad — will occur at random intervals to add a bit of chaos and uncertainty to each player’s perfect plan.

SCALE: Each hex of a Combat Commander map is roughly 100 feet of distance (about 30 meters). Each complete Player Phase abstractly represents several seconds of real time. Each complete measure of Game Time abstractly represents several minutes of real time.

Each unit in the game is approximated as either a single Leader, a 5-man Team, or a 10-man Squad. Radios — and individual weapons larger than a pistol, rifle or BAR — are represented by their own counters.
21050.name: Combat Commander: Europe

21051.description:
Tooor! is based on Finale, a game published 7 years earlier. It´s easier and faster to play.

Both players act as football coaches. Every football team contains eleven players. Circles on the edge of a players' portrait symbolize his fitness state. To make a move, each player chooses up to three players. The sum of the circled numbers added to the dice rolling total equals your movement potential. The winner of this duel has the chance to score a goal. After the duel all concerned footballers are rotated by 90 degrees, so that the player fitness is constantly being updated and changed.

Re-implements:

Finale
21051.name: Tooor!

21052.name: Tactica Medieval
21052.description:
Tactica Medieval is, not surprisingly, an adaptation of the Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming ancients period rules set to the medieval period. There are three games included in the book: an army game, a siege game (involving boiling oil, siege engines, siege towers, etc.) and a campaign system.

Army lists for the major armies from about 1000-1500AD are included.

21053.description:
Small cards are laid out face down on the table picturing either a Rabbit (always face down) or a Fox (initially face up) , Foxes in a circle, Rabbits inside that circle.
Play :
- If a player is sure to uncover a Rabbit, he can do so and earn a Carrot if he´s right. In that case he also takes a Fox card, turns it face down and replaces the Rabbit card (which is discarded) with it.
- Otherwise, he can throw the dice. According to the result of the dice he gets a Carrot (for free), or has to pick either a Fox or a Rabbit from the face down cards, which earns him a Carrot if he gets it right.

Player with most Carrots wins.

Alternate names : "Carrot Catching", "Lapins et Renards"
21053.name: Möhren mopsen

21054.name: Battle to Baghdad
21054.description:
From the Jiggi Games website:

"The US invasion of Iraq is now being played out all around the world. Jiggi Games has incorporated the events of the Iraq war into a reality board game.
Each player commands 3000 troops as you battle your way through Iraq. You will take out airports, night bomb cities, hunt down Saddam Hussein, and take over Baghdad...but look out!
This game is full of rebel attacks, car bombers, snipers, and other sorts of danger."

21055.description:
The Players balance cargo on a bamboo ship. If you tip over the ship, you're out.

From the box quoted exactly:
Let's go sailing on this sunny day! Load up the picnic baskets and all which is needed for a lovely day on the water. But keep an eye on the loading, because the sea water keeps the boat unstable. Balancing fun on wild waters!

Contents: 1 sailing boat with flag, 36 bamboo cargo items in 3 different shapes 1 dice (sic). For 2-6 players. From 4 years of age. 100% natural bamboo.
21055.name: Cagola

21056.name: Morocco
21056.description:
In Morocco, players become merchants in the open-air Moroccan market, trading their wares in an attempt to drum up interest, selling them when profitable and storing them in their warehouses in hopes of future gains. Keeping a shrewd eye on what their fellow merchants are up to and a keen sense of timing will make you the richest merchant in Morocco!

Morocco is an economic card game for 3-5 players.

21057.name: Pull The Rug Out
21057.description:
A variety of plastic objects (ten are supplied) are balanced on top of each other on a special 'rug', the order of which is determined randomly by a spinner. At any time after playing a minimum of two objects, a player may elect to "pull the rug out" from beneath their structure. If any objects fall no points are scored; if no objects fall one point is awarded for each object used.

The first player to twenty points wins the game.

21058.name: Slim River
21058.description:
On January 7, the British 12th Brigade, which had been hammered back for weeks, now faced a new bold foe: Japanese tanks (type 95 and 97) composed of two companies supported by the 42nd Regiment. With only a few antitank weapons, the British defenders were hard pressed when the Japanese bold use of armor in the jungles began at 0330. What followed was simply a mini-blitzkrieg as the Japanese tanks found numerous previously undiscovered roads through which to bypass British defenses. The British really did not know what hit them and by 0830, the Japanese had secured the Slim River bridge and the road to Singapore was open. In the game, chance cards create the uncertainty of battle from the sudden approach of Japanese aircraft, discovering a bypass road, stumbling onto a minefield, or the sudden activation of British units. Formation cards determine which formations activate and in which order, depending on the player that plays them. This will vary with every game turn. All this creates a totally unpredictable game.

The game comes with a 11x17 in. map, 280 counters, formation and chance cards, which are used to activate the counters on the map, a rulebook. The scale is 350 yards per hex, platoons, individual tanks\weapons, 30 min. turns for a total of 11 turns.

21059.description:
Dunwich Horror is a large-box expansion for the Fantasy Flight Games edition of Arkham Horror, and is a part of the Arkham Horror Series.

Once again, terror has come to New England, this time spreading to the small country town of Dunwich, just a few miles from Arkham. The area is filled with rolling hills, many of which are topped with mysterious stone circles or the ramshackle houses of the recluses who live outside of town. At night, the piping of the whippoorwills fills the air, while lightning bugs dance in the witch-haunted hallows. This is a place where dark pacts with unknown forces are made, and where city folk go to disappear without a trace. But however much the people of Dunwich may distrust outsiders, they desperately need your help against the Horror that has manifested on the Whateley farm...

Dunwich Horror adds 8 Investigators, 4 Ancient Ones, 15 Item cards, 25 Unique Item cards, 21 Spell cards, 11 Skill cards, 5 Ally cards, 4 Condition cards, 28 Monster tokens, 36 Mythos cards and 32 Gate cards to the base set. It also adds new location cards, for a total of 14 cards at each location instead of 7. Dunwich Horror also adds many new mechanics. Players can take a train to Dunwich (a new board that is placed on the end of the Arkham board), which adds 9 new locations and 2 new outer worlds to the game. Players reduced to 0 stamina or sanity have the option of drawing from the Injury or Madness deck, acquiring permanent handicaps, rather than losing half their items and clue tokens. Gates are no longer permanently sealed (a popular house rule in the base game). Condition cards provide benefits to all players may be activated. And, of course, the Dunwich Horror itself - not as strong as the Ancient Ones, yet far stronger than any other monster in the game.

This expansion also features revised rules and an FAQ that addresses many of the perceived faults of the base game. Replacement cards are provided for items and spells that are subject to errata.
21059.name: Arkham Horror: Dunwich Horror Expansion

21061.name: Go/Stop
21061.description: Go/Stop is a quick game that you try to obtain the highest point card (1-10). Everyone start with the set of identical cards (5 go cards and 1 stop card). For every point card flipped from the deck, everyone bids for it simultaneously face down. (Go=you don't want the card. Stop=you want that card) Then goes to the next point card. After 5 turns, the point is resolved. If only one person bid stop. The game is over and we resolve all the other point cards. If none or 2 or more stops, they cancel each other and everyone takes that card back. And keep going until there is only one left. Quick and gives new twist for Raj type game.

21062.description:
This game appeared in Vae Victis issue 65. It covers the first two years of the Seven Years' War (1757-8). Each turn represents forty days of real time, each counter is a "brigade equivalent."

This issue also includes counters and a scenario for Paris vaut bien une messe (issue 50), covering the battle of Moncontour (1569), and the usual collection of articles and reviews. As with all VV games, the counters must be assembled prior to play.
21062.name: Frédéric II: La guerre de Sept Ans

21063.description:
[Translated from French, so might not be completely accurate...]

Calypso is at the same time a game of memory and deduction. In the center of the table, 6 tiles show fish of different colors, with another colored fish on the reverse. There are 4 colors in total. When the die roll shows a blue fish, you must turn over a plate to reveal a blue fish. It is thus useful to remember the movements of the fish. But when your memory fails, your powers of deduction can take over.

Imagine that you must turn over a red fish and that the situation on the table is as follows:

Purple fish, Yellow fish, Yellow fish, Blue fish, Blue fish, Blue fish

You can deduce that a red fish is under purple fish. Indeed, the three blue fish are blue/red, blue/yellow and blue/purple. The two yellow fish are thus yellow/red and yellow/purple. The last fish is thus purple/red, the only missing combination.

This combination of reasoning and memory allows kids and adults to play each other. Whilst the adults can play the reasoning game, kids are generally much better at memory games!
21063.name: Calypso

21064.name: Tall Tales
21064.description: Tall Tales is essentially a card game where players attempt to bluff the other players, with urban myths, legends, little-known-facts or their own stories.

21065.name: Azacru
21065.description:
Azacru has one objective: to have as many squares of your color on the board at the end of the game. There two very different dynamics at work in the game. Since you cannot land on a square of another player's color, part of the game focuses on blocking opposition pieces and avoiding being blocked. However the game features a "connection change" move which involves pre-planning so that you can move one of your pieces several squares across to another square already of your color. Potentially this could be right across the board, which is a 9 by 9 grid.

Each time a piece moves the square it lands on becomes its own color, and the number of colored squares it has in one of the nine 3x3 borderlands on the game board determines the power of movement the piece has.

If the connection change involves changing a square of opposition color then your piece leaves the game, but this can also be to your advantage since the game ends shortly after the first person playing is in a position where they cannot move any pieces. So players strive to get ahead on squares and then cause any early end to the game ... or wait so that they can make a dramatic connection change on the last turn that follows the first person being unable to move.

Azacru is one of the games featured in the Pacru Series 302 game box of 2005 (the games all use the same board, pieces/chevrons and markers). Separate entries exist for Pacru, Shacru & Azacru.

21066.name: Shacru
21066.description:
The object of Shacru is to acquire as many squares of your color on the board as possible before the game is over. The board is a 9 by 9 grid divided into 9 borderlands of 3 by 3 squares (could now be mistaken for Sudoku!), and at the start of the game all of the squares are neutral (not colored).

With 2 players there are four pieces (aka chevrons) each, with 3 or 4 players three pieces each.

Each time you move a piece the square you move onto becomes your color. You can move onto neutral squares, or squares of your own color, but not onto squares of a different color. So the game focuses on blocking the pieces of other players, and avoiding your pieces becoming blocked.

Pieces move only forwards (forwards directly or forwards to left or right). When a piece crosses a border the player can twist the piece 45 degrees to the left or right.

The game ends when no player can gain any more squares of their color (either because none of their pieces can move, or because they can only move around onto squares that are already their colour).

Shacru was first published as part of the Pacru 101 game, and again with the Pacru 302 game. It can also be played with crayons and paper with the addition of some colored chevron/arrow shaped pieces to move around the paper. Free software exists at http://www.pacru.com/shacru.html.

The game is suitable for anyone aged five years or over.

Separate entries exist for Pacru, Shacru & Azacru as opinions vary widely on the 3 games.

21067.description:
Designed to be the truest, simplest hexagonal variant of chess, Hexes Chess is played on 54 hexagons rather than 64 squares. Though it uses fewer "spaces" and fewer pieces than conventional chess, the hexagonal format greatly increases the mobility of each piece.

If you are familiar with the rules of chess, you will find Hexes Chess to be logical and intuitive. Even if you are new to chess, the illustrated rules sheet will have you playing in minutes.
21067.name: Hexes Chess

21068.name: Slangsters
21068.description: A game of slang expressions. One person/team gives a slang expression, the opposing team must come up with the definition. 300 cards included in game, 5 categories on each card. Things To Do, Places To Go & People To See, Grab Bag Rally, Whatchamacallits, Kissing Cousins. Subcategories sometimes provided. Rolled die determines category chosen. Each card has a different letter on sides, and players must spell out SLANGSTERS to win. Cards may be traded between teams.

21070.name: Warte und pass auf!
21070.description:
"Wait and watch - my first Traffic game" is a dice game for teaching traffic rules to preschool and early primary school children.

A double sided board depicts 2 street scenes - 1 side showing a street with a zebra (pedestrian) crossing and the other side a street without a crossing but with 4 "waiting" zones. The players must move via dice rolls from their homes on one side of the street to the color-specific goal on the other side (e.g. bakery, playground, sweetshop etc).

A large wooden dice controls movement but 2 sides show a car symbol which if rolled, result in the cars moving along the road. Meeples can't cross the street unless they finished their last turn in a waiting square at the side of the road and only if both cars have passed by or are stopped at the zebra crossing waiting.

Contents:
1 double sided board
1 large dice sides: 2, 3, 3, 4, car, car
4 colored meeples : blue, pink, green, yellow
2 wooden cars
1 instruction booklet

21071.description:
This is the first expansion pack for CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game including a new 12 sided die for new gameplay.

Expands:

CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game
21071.name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation Boardgame – Crime Game & Booster Pack #1

10715.name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game

21072.name: Santoska
21072.description:
Simple card game about picking up cards and minimizing collected points. As the cards are kept face down you have to memorize them before you put them down.
The game includes special cards and has some nice extra rules to eliminate negative points. It's nicely scale-able for different levels of difficulty.

Home Page: http://santoska.nl/

21073.name: The Great Railroad Game
21073.description:
By Playthings Past:
The Great Railroad Game is based on a game originally published by the R. Bliss Manufacturing Company in 1891. This game comes in a tin box with the original game cover reproduced on the tin cover. It includes 2 train pegs and 1 train die, a scoring pencil, the United States playing platform and instructions and history.

21074.description:
Monochrome Chess is played with 2 identical Chess sets, set up as you would for ordinary Chess, except with the same color on both sides of the board. The objective is to capture pieces (including the King) of your opponent.

Any piece positioned on your side of the board (i.e. the 4 rows closest to you) is yours, while any piece on the other side of the board belongs to your opponent. Any time you move a piece across the center line, it becomes your opponent's piece. You may only capture pieces belonging to your opponent, so pieces which get moved onto your side of the board can only be captured by your opponent. There is no "check" or "checkmate": a king may be captured, and the game ends if one player runs out of pieces.

The player who has the captured the highest point-value total of the opponents pieces is the winner. (K = 10, Q = 8, R= 5, B = 4, Kt 3, P = 1)
21074.name: Monochrome  Chess

21075.name: RAEj
21075.description:
From reading the rules:

A bizarre and unlikely combination of checkers, Chinese checkers, backgammon, and chess.

Note: production quality of this game is surprisingly high. The "checkers" feel to be made of high-quality material, and feel cool and smooth to the touch, reminiscent of 'Go' stones, but much larger (and flat). They have star outline, star-filled, and star-filled in a circle designed etched into them: 1 set blue etchings, 1 set red etchings. The board is standard hard cardboard. The board art is gray background with white lines, with blue and red stars, triangles, and square delineated colored zones.

From the rules:

Each player starts with 1 'pawn' (checker) and 1 "King' (checker with a star in a circle design} on their designated opposed short-sides of the 9 x 10 square board. Two dice (each numbered only 1-3) are rolled to determine movement.

"Pawns" (checkers) move forward or sideways and can only jump other "pawns".

"Knights' (checkers with a star design) are created by jumping a "pawn" with its own "King", They can jump "pawns" or "knights", and may not be jumped by "pawns". When a "pawn" is knighted, the checker is flipped over to it's star-design side.

"Kings" (checker with a star in a circle design) move forward, backward, or sideways. They can jump any piece, but must stay out of the opponent's "holding zone" (a 3 x 3 square area in the middle of the opponent's side).

A piece may enter the board on a player's holding zone when a 2 is rolled on a die, and is moved the number on the other die.

A piece may leave the board when it is in a "destination square" (located on the last rank of the opponents side of the board) on any roll.

Captures are only made by a King. When a king jumps an opposing piece, that piece is placed back in the opponent's 'holding zone' (effectively starting over it's journey).

There is a scoring system in place for end-of game (Pawns with 1, Knights 2, Kings 4), and the doubling-cube is used to issue challenges during play.

The rule-sheet has a small section on strategies, and "Championship tournament" guidelines. Very ambitious.

21076.description: The players form two teams of two players or one player can give the clue to two guessers. Players take one card which has ten passwords on it. A spinner determines which word will be the password for this round. The clue giver can give multi-word clues and use pantomime (unlike the classic version of the game which restricts the players to one-word clues and no gestures). Teams alternate turns until someone guesses the password. Any player who guesses the password is awarded the card for scorekeeping purposes. The first team awarded six cards is the winner.
21076.name: Password Junior

21078.name: Second World War
21078.description:
Strategic level game covering WW2 in Europe, North Africa and the Middle East.

The game was created as an introduction to military simulation for students taking the conflict simulation course run by its' designer at King's College London. As such it was designed to be the simplest possible representation of the war.

Game consists of
-12 page rulebook including examples and historical commentary. Sections covered are; The map, The units, Sequence of play, Movement, Tactical combat, Strategic combat, Production, Neutrality, Victory and Initial set-up.
-Map intended to be printed at A4 size.
-50 double sided counters.

Movement is by large areas, combat by die rolling. Strategic warfare is represented in abstract fashion, attacking industrial production.

21079.name: Monster Hunters
21079.description:
Monster Hunters is a card game where players are trying to either be the last hunter standing or the hunter with the most bounty points. The game involves a fair amount of screwing over other players. Monsters are killed by rolling against their rating with a six-sided die.

The game comes packaged simply in a plastic zip-top bag, with thick, laminated cards and a brief (but concise) rulebook.

21081.description:
A "Mini-Spiel" by HABA stored in a metal tin.

From the box: "Very carefully the little red bear climbs on the shoulder of the blue bear. The tower of bears is already four bears high and gets more and more wobbly. A moment of carelessness is sufficient to make the bears lose their balance and tumble down.

A game of skill for 2-4 bear-piling players ages 5-99.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (17-08-2009) --!>
21081.name: Bären-Blues

21083.description: War Game Rules 1925-1950 by Phil Barker, often called WGR 1925-1950 was one of Phil Barker's later developments of his miniatures wargame rules for modern combat (twentieth century). The original editions came out in June 1973 and the game has steadily developed since then. The 1988 WGR 1925-1950 covers all sorts of combat from the year 1925 through 1950 which allows combat before WWII and a few post-WWII conflicts including the Korean War and the 1948 War for Israeli Independence.
21083.name: War Game Rules 1925-1950

21084.name: Go For It
21084.description: This is a very simple dice game with four different colored dice and grid cards. Players take turns rolling the dice and writing the roles down in columns. The goal is to be the first to complete a run of four or four of a kind in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal line.

21085.name: Fashion Atrocity Strikes
21085.description: Fashion Atrocity Strikes is a card game of wanna-be superheroes trying to get dressed. Game includes cut-out paper clothing, cards and two six-sided dice.

21086.description:
35 of the 39 tiles show different parts of locomotives, passenger and freight carriages, and the other four are Conductor cards. The cards are of thick cardboard and are taller than they are wide. All tiles are shuffled together and placed face down. Players draw a hand of 5 cards in the 2-player game, or 3 cards in the 3 or 4-player version.
Players take it in turns to draw one card, and then must either lay one from their hand, or discard one to a discard pile. Train pieces must match together, but can be started from the middle of the carriage or engine. New locomotives or carriages can be started against a completed one, to form a longer train.

The game ends once a player has completed a locomotive and one or more carriages, and also has one of the conductor cards in their hand. Points are then awarded for completed locomotives and carriages, and conductors in the hand. Highest score wins.
21086.name: Take a Train

21087.description:
A expension set to Flintloque by the same designer, Deadloque features the same small units skirmish in a black powder fantasy universe.

This time, the action takes place in the frozen Witchlands, pitting remnants of the retreating elven army of Mordred against hordes of undead of the Star-Wraith Alexander, led by the Lich Stalinov.

The game features the same light rules as Flintloque, with additional rules for magic, zombies and werewolves, as well as a lot of tongue-in-cheek humor.
21087.name: Deadloque (first edition)

21088.name: Mysteres
21088.description:
Maybe a pearl for "da Vinci Code" fans. Three to eight players compete among themselves in order to find the solution of a famous "mystere".
The treasure of Templars, the secret of Abbee Sauniere, the Sacred Graal, the mystery of Sphynx, Atlantis, Mu, etc. etc. Many famous and great mysteries are present.

Each player has a secret mission, and he has to collect a set of clues, items and locations in order to reach his goal, often competing with his opponents.
Players can also perform a lot of actions: they can steal a clue, they can sabotage or evenly throw off tack the investigation of their opponents...

The game can be FREELY downloaded for print, cut & play at:

www.calvinuslab.tk

Italian version is the only one currently available.

21089.name: Hexagrams
21089.description: Abstract positional game played on a board tiled with hexagons and equilateral triangles. Each player has two kinds of pieces: "Triads" - Pawn-like pieces which move on the triangles, and "Hexads" - Larger pieces which occupy the hexagons. The object of the game is to capture or immobilize all of your opponent's hexads.

21091.name: Pitch-A-Story!
21091.description:
THE GAME:

The PITCH-A-STORY! board gives you and your teammates a
chance to create and act out stories during every turn in all
kinds of places where story is king — film, TV, cartoons,
literature, theater, and storytelling festivals.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:

To become a star by earning credits and review points
awarded by your fellow players when you pitch stories using
story elements from the game cards.

21092.description: This extension to London 1888 adds new characters, action cards and weapons to the original mix. New event cards will allow the players to change the course of the game. Also a new mechanic is introduced to increase the tension between the players.
21092.name: Whitechapel

21093.name: Il Rischiatutto
21093.description: Italian board game of the '70, based on the popular quiz show "Il rischiatutto".

21094.name: Overstag
21094.description:
Sailing game where the players have to sail an Olympic sailing track on a Frisian (province of Holland)lake. The first to sail his ship across the finish line wins the game.
The game contains:
- a gameboard
- six ships
- one starting ship
- one freighter (obstacle)
- 3 buoys
- 22 bonus cards
- 22 penalty cards
- 2 dice

Produced as a promotional game for Sonnema, producer of the famous Frisian bitter, Beerenburg

21095.name: Mage Master
21095.description:
Mage Master is a role playing game where you as a magic caster quest for the ultimate magic that is contained within the ancient arch mage's tomb.

Starting out as a basic wizard with only limited magic ability, you travel the land in search of means to increase your power. There are magic ingredients to collect to cast your spells, terrible creatures to overcome, strange and mysterious people to meet and powerful magic items to find.

You can train to become a sorcerer, able to cast more powerful magic and eventually you can learn enough to become a great mage.

Battle the other players in this race to become the master of all mages and be known henceforth as the Mage Master.

21096.description:
The players are two royal builders competing to build their castle first. Each player in turn places a wall of his color. When a player manages to form a square with three or more sides of his color, he places a castle inside. The first player to place all five castles wins.

From the box:
Once upon a time there were 2 royal master-builders. They were competing for the favors of the beautiful queen. Which of them will be the first to finish a new castle for her majesty?

Content(sic): 5 green towers (2 with roof (sic), 3 without roof), 5 yellow towers (2 with roof, 3 without roof), 15 green walls, 15 yellow walls
For 2 players. From 4 years of age.

100% natural bamboo

Re-implemented by:

Castella³
21096.name: Castella

21097.description:
"De Koloniën van Catan" (Catan's Colonies) is a separately sold expansion for Catan, based upon the scenario "Die Kolonien" from Das Buch zum Spielen. It also needs Seafarers.

For centuries a large island in the ocean is waiting to be settled. It has a lot of exotic resources. Of course the settlers of Catan want to make money from these scarce resources. But the resources first need to be moved to the coast, and from there overseas to the home island. A logistic nightmare, but the gains make up for it.

The scenario was published by Kosmos in 2007 to mark the tenth anniversary of The Seafarers of Catan.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands

Catan
21097.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: De Koloniën

21098.description:
"De Woestijnruiters van Catan" is a separately sold expansion to Catan derived from the scenario "Die Steppenreiter" from "das Buch zum Spielen".

In the North-West of Catan the riders lie in ambush. The inhabitants of Catan see this coming, but can do little to avoid it. There is only one way out: flee. Hastily the frightened settlers flee oversees to one of the small islands. Then, the barbarian riders appear and spread over the land, destroying everything in their way. Cities, villages, and landscapes, nothing is safe.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands

Catan
21098.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: De Woestijnruiters

21099.description:
"Het Grote Kanaal van Catan" (Catan's Great Canal) is a separately sold expansion to Catan.

A large area of Catan is threatened by drought. The only way out is to dig an enormous canal from the sea to this area. All knights of Catan are summoned to get this job done. Attracted by large financial gains, they start working on the canal. Mostly together with other knights, the knights complete bit by bit of the canal. Finally the fields of Catan can be irrigated and Catan has wheat again.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands

Catan
21099.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: Het Grote Kanaal

21100.description:
"De Wonderen van Catan" (Wonders of Catan), is a separately sold expansion to Catan.

Even in Catan the wish exists to get into the history books. To that end, a monument needs to be built. Of course every architect decides what monument he wants to build. Every monument has its own unique benefits. Normally the settlers of Catan are appreciated for their achievements in city building and development. Wonders, however, have a separate status. Without a wonder, you will stay a nobody.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands

Catan
21100.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: De Wereldwonderen

21101.description:
"Diamanten voor Catan" (Diamonds for Catan) is a separately sold expansion for Catan. It needs the Catan: Seafarers expansion to be played.

People are rarely ever satisfied. The settlers of Catan have everything their heart desires, until news reaches them that diamonds are found on a few of the neighboring islands. The greedy inhabitants immediately leave to seize as much as possible. Of course the pirates stand ready to rob them of their precious stones. Most settlers, however, succeed in getting some stones back home.

Belongs to the Catan Series.
21101.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: De Diamanten

21102.name: Acquisition
21102.description:
ACQUISITION
Is a board game for up to 6 players, and is recommended for ages 18 years and over. The game is unique and delivers a combination of social interaction; forward thinking, challenges, strategy and most importantly fun!

GAME OBJECTIVE

The object of the game is a race to acquire three (3) of the five (5) Gold Status Symbols to determine who will become "The Ultimate Status Champion".

The decision as to which Gold Status Symbols you acquire depends on your strategy to try and win the game against the other players, although it is compulsory for every player to acquire the "House" as one (1) of the three (3) Gold Status Symbol Cards required to win the game. Each player starts the game with a mortgage (debt) that must be cleared before the game can be won. That is why the "House" is a compulsory acquisition.

Each player must collect sufficient credits to enable the purchase of silver status symbol cards as shown on the game board, to increase their wealth and status.

Each Gold Status Symbol card has four (4) silver status symbol cards that must be purchased before the Gold Status Symbol Card can be issued.
All Silver and Gold Status Symbol cards are color coded for easy playing reference (Red, Green, Purple, Blue, White).

21104.description:
From the Publisher:

Sky Full of Stars is a major supplement for the A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat space combat game. Within these jam-packed pages, you will find rules updates, new rules, advanced fleet lists, many new scenarios and a revised campaign system. Everything the Call to Arms player needs to take his fleet into the next war!

New Rules
Including rules for Boarding Actions, Planetary Assaults, Space Stations, Famous Commanders and much more.

Advanced Fleet Lists
Many new ships grace these fleet lists, both variants of existing hull designs and some brand new ships (such as the dreaded Shadow Omega). In addition, the League of Non-Aligned Worlds have now been split so you can field independent fleets, and the White Star has been revised to become born again hard!

New Scenarios
As well as a great many new tactical challenges, included are many scenarios based on the TV series, allowing you to fight out the conflicts that took place on the screen - will you do better?

BOX SET OWNERS: If you own the original A Call to Arms box set (as opposed to the new Revised Edition), all you need to fully update to the new rules set is this book - you do NOT need the Revised box set as well.

Expands:

A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat
21104.name: Babylon 5: A Sky Full of Stars

13455.name: A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat

21105.name: The Minneapolis-St. Paul opolygame
21105.description:
A Monopoly variant based in the Minneapolis-St. Paul area of Minnesota. Comes with a 1-page sheet that gives a short history of the Twin Cities.

From the instructions: "Entrepreneurs acquire Business Licenses, develop Offices, and purchase various goods and services (thereby stimulating the local economy)... Accumulate the portfolio of business holdings with the greatest net worth."

About NationalOpoly Sales Corporation: "Headquartered in San Diego, California, has produced city games in Chicago, Detroit, Honolulu, Minneapolis-St. Paul, Sacramento, and San Diego. Nationalopoly has made a commitment to aiding community organizations in each of these cities. As a result, NationalOpoly will contribute a minimum of $.50 of every Minneapolis-St. Paul game sold to the Boys & Girls Club of Minneapolis."

21106.description:
Splash Mountain Sorry! is one of the tin boxed Disney Theme Park Editions. They are only sold at Disney resorts and theme parks. The playing pieces represent the log boats that guests ride through the attraction on.

The game Sorry! The Disney Edition a normally boxed version sold in regular stores, with themed “teams” of characters from multiple Disney films.
21106.name: Sorry! Splash Mountain

21107.name: One for the Pot!
21107.description: Players roll a die & move around a circular board filling opponent's (and their own!) teacups full of sugar cubes, spoons & squirts of water from a centrally located teapot. Players are eliminated from the game when their cups overflow.

21108.name: Rain, Rain Go Away...
21108.description:
Quaint late '60s offering from Ideal. Plastic shelters are assembled on the roll-out plastic gameboard before players spin & move. In addition to regulation numerals on the spinner, there are 'umbrella' and 'rain' areas. Players spinning the umbrella get to slot the small plastic umbrella provided with the game in the allocated position in their mover's hand where it remains until the umbrella is spun by an opponent. If 'rain' is spun, all players without the umbrella must return to the closest previous shelter passed on the road.

The first player to reach the finish space is the winner and gets to squirt the losers with the hose (optional house rule).

21110.description:
The Hippo's are bathing. They like their privacy, and surround themselves with rocks and plants. They don't like crocodiles!

In this simple but fun kid's game, players draw and place cards around each other's Hippos. Plants score positive points, crocs negative.
21110.name: Hipp Hipp Hippo!

21111.description: The animals are going out and must get dressed. Players are shown an animal's outfit and try to find the necessary clothes. The Hippopotumus' stripey bra? The Elephant's top hat? You can't let the animals go out naked!
21111.name: Jacke Wie Hose!

21112.name: Wort-schWatz
21112.description: Another quick word game, this has the trick that the letters can be read any which way up. That h could be a y, that Z is an N. Players scramble to get the best words from the cards on the table.

21114.name: Nurkanvaltaajat
21114.description:
Nurkanvaltaajat is a Finnish economy game where you're supposed to gather a certain amount of property as soon as possible by buying and selling shares of companies. An unlucky situation can lead a player to bankruptcy and out of the game.

Prices of the shares vary randomly according to share price cards and a player can sometimes be offered with cheap shares. Players use pencil and paper to stay on track with their stock portfolios because the amount of shares isn't limited.

The goal of the game is decided by the players so its playing time may vary a lot.

21115.name: Sail Back L'approdo
21115.description:
Both players have to reach other side of board (enemy's island) and have to choose the way to reach it faster than opposite player.
During the journey the ships can try to sink enemy’s ship shooting them.

21117.name: Memoradar
21117.description:
Players have to make a pool of cards copying exactly the pool locked in twisting plastic structure.
The fastest one gain victory point and the twisting were replaced by other cards.

21118.name: The Hottest Race in the World
21118.description:
This six player game is an upgraded version of Formula 1 Fever, which allows gamers to experience the thrills of F1 racing in the comfort of their own home. Gamers have the choice of competing in a single race or the entire F1 championships playing on the different race tracks similar to the actual F1 Championship.

Each player (driver) has an identical deck of movement cards, which also represents their fuel, so if at any time during the game they run out of cards, they are out of the game!

Before the race, players are given 12 construction points to customize their cars according to how they think it will race best on the track selected (the basic game comes with 2 tracks - Malaysia & Japan). Players can choose from better:
- Acceleration (1 point).
- Braking (1 point).
- Cornering (2 points).
- Special features (3 points).

The race is over 3 laps, and players begin with 5 cards from their deck, and 3 "Event" cards (which introduce elements such as rain, safety car, etc).

Each round, players starting with the race leader:
1) Decide if he/she wishes to play an "Event" card. The effects take place immediately.
2) Must play 1 "Movement" card and MAY play 1 other card (Acceleration, Braking, Cornering or Special).
3) Players then move their cars according to the modified score of their cards.

As in real life, players have to really plan how to negotiate the corners, where penalty points in the form of tire wear is imposed if players pass the corners. Essentially, players who land on the corners receive no penalty.

Players also have to plan tactically when to make their pit stops, and whether they take a short one (just top up petrol), or a longer one (where they also change tires).

In the end, players who manage their resources well, take risks at the right time and plan their pit stops well will emerge the winner!

21119.name: Hudson River Sloops
21119.description: Hudson River Sloops simulates trade along the Hudson River during the early 1800's. The river cargo was transported by the sloops navigating the tricky winds and waters of the Hudson. Cargo was shipped between New York and Albany. There are 10 river ports and 8 commodities. Commodities vary in worth its source distance from Manhattan and market condition.

21120.name: Tantalizer
21120.description:
"The Optical Illusion Game
The only game played backwards!"

A series of 10 'projects' or challenges that are timed. The fastest wins. All projects involve a blind and a mirror, so that the players must accomplish the feats by looking at the reflection.

21121.name: Grabbin Dragons
21121.description:
The object of the game is to be the player whose dragon collects the most magical ring using the tail-pulling mechanism.

Once you begin, you and your friend(s) race to hook rings on to your dragon's tongue, pull its tail so that its neck bends back and drops the ring into the ring container and repeat. You can also use your dragon to try and knock rings off the tongues of opponent dragons. Once all the rings are gone, count them up. Whoever has the most wins.

Because there are three different colors of rings you can easily institute variants where certain color rings are worth more than others.

21122.description:
Z CARDZ are special pre-punched cards that can be assembled into 3-D models.

Z CARDZ the Game allows you and an opponent to build an army of these Z CARDZ. Through the use of special formation cards, you try to be the first one to KO all of your opponents Z CARDZ.

Booster packs contain 5 models and a matching playing card for each model. Pack contents consist of 3 normal models and 2 "special" models, colored in either metallic silver (rare) or metallic gold (ultra-rare). 60 different models are available in booster packs, each having a normal, rare, and ultra-rare version, resulting in a set size of 180 models.
21122.name: Z Cardz

21123.name: Monopoly: Disney/Pixar
21123.description: This version of Monopoly is themed after the Disney/Pixar films: Toy Story (1 & 2), A Bug's Life, Monster's Inc., Finding Nemo, and The Incredibles. Special collectible tokens include: Woody, Nemo, Buzz Lightyear, Sulley, Mr.Incredible, and Flick.

21124.name: Monopoly: Disney Theme Park
21124.description:
This version of Monopoly is one of the tin boxed Disney Theme Park Editions. They are only sold at Disney resorts and theme parks. The famous rides and attractions are bought, sold, and traded by the players. Main Street USA buildings act as houses while Disney castles sub for hotels. Eight collectible player tokens modeled after various ride modes of transportation are also included.

The game Monopoly: the Disney Edition (2001) a normally boxed version sold in regular stores with properties based on Disney films.

21125.name: Marvel ReCharge CCG
21125.description:
Two players face off with their deck of Marvel Superheroes. For every battle, you compare the power numbers on their respective Hero cards with the highest number winning. Other cards, such as Power cards and Teamwork cards, can be used to bump up the power total or bring other Hero cards into play respectively.

Counters are used to bet on the outcome of a turn, with the first player to 30 points worth of counters being the winner.

21126.name: Transportation Tricks
21126.description:
Transportation Tricks is a trick taking card game wherein the suits and values are separated into two different decks. Players bid to set the value of tricks in the various suits, and then play out the hand as in any typical trick taking game.

Transportation Tricks has been self published (at prototype quality) in an edition of 13 copies. All information on the status of the print run (including information on acquiring copies for however so long they remain available) will solely be available in the Announcements forum for the game here on BGG.

21127.name: Atlantic City Jackpot
21127.description: Atlantic City Jackpot was published as a marketing tie-in with the Resorts International Atlantic City Casino and Hotel. Players take the role of gamblers spending a week in Atlantic City, high rolling their way to a fat life of riches and glamour. Each turn around the board constitutes one day of play time, during which the active player may gamble on craps, blackjack, the slots, and other games of chance. At any point the non-moving players may place side bets in favor of the moving player or the house.

21128.name: Piggy Bank Card Game
21128.description:
This card game is intended for 2 to 4 children ages 3 to 9. The game can be played three different ways.

1. PIGGY BANK: The entire deck is dealt to all players. Each turn a player turns over one card from his or her dealt pile. A card showing a nickel or five pennies is "banked". Other cards are placed in the center of the table in the "till". When a player draws a card that will match a card in the "till" to make five cents, those two cards are "banked". Cards can only be "banked" in two (or one) card combinations. The Silver Pig card is worth 10 cents -- two tricks. The player with the most money wins the game and becomes the next dealer.

2. DIME BANK: Plays like "Piggy Bank" except that players "bank" 10 cents instead of 5 cents, and the Silver Pig is worth 20 cents. (It is unclear how to avoid the two-card limit in this version.)

3. CONCENTRATION: This version is similar to the game card game Memory. It is for any number of players. Players "bank" pairs to add up to either 10 cents or 5 cents. A player's turn ends upon turning up the Silver Pig card. The game ends when there are two cards left, and a player uncovers a five-cent card and then the Silver Pig; this combination is worth two tricks.

21129.name: Walt Disney's Disneyland Card Game
21129.description:
The 1964 version has two different games.

The Disney character cards are numbered 1 to 10 with four cards of each suit. However, the suits are red hearts, yellow sunbursts, blue five-pointed stars, and white daisy flowers. There are also four Donald Duck cards of a "wild" shamrock suit. The #1 cards are Mickey Mouse, the #2 cards are Minnie Mouse, the #3 cards are Pluto, the #4 cards are Thumper, the #5 cards are Goofy, the #6 cards are Dumbo, the #7 cards are Clarabelle, the #8 cards are Flower, the #9 cards are Daisy Duck, and the #10 cards are Chip 'n' Dale. The last card is an instruction card.

Game 1: The four #1 cards are placed face-up on the table. The remaining cards are shuffled and dealt to each player. The player to the left of the dealer begins by playing a #2 card on a #1 card of the same color; this player can discard a second card by playing a #3 card of the same suit or any other #2 card. A player can only discard up to two cards per turn. A Donald Duck card is to be played as an #11 card to complete a pile. The first player to discard all his or her cards gains 10 points. A player must gain 50 points to win the game.

Game 2: The second game is similar to a version of Crazy Eights or Uno. Each player is dealt five cards. The remaining cards are placed in a face down stack with one card turn upright. Players discard cards by matching either the suit or number or by playing a wild Donald Duck card. When a wild Donald Duck card is discarded, it is played sideways so that the next player will have to match the card underneath by suit or number or with another wild Donald Duck card. The winner is the first player to discard all of his cards.

21130.description:
The Centurion Technical Update contains newly introduced battlefield weapons, vehicles, and equipment for use with Centurion. Also included are new optional rules, a campaign generator, and rules for running double blind Centurion games.

Expands:

Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel
21130.name: Renegade Legion: Centurion Technical Update

21131.name: Mixies
21131.description:
The 1965 version has three scenarios. The deck consists of 36 cards. The first card displays an advertisement for this product, the next two cards show a list of instructions, and the other 33 cards are divided equally between circus character pictures of heads, bodies, and legs.

Game #1: This version is essentially the only game. It is for 3 or 4 players. The head cards are divided equally among the players. The rest of the cards are mixed up and spread face down on the table. Player take turns revealing cards in a memory game type fashion. A player with a "head" card must uncover a "body" card while a player with "head" and "body" cards must uncover a "legs" card, otherwise the turn passes to the next player. The first player to complete all of his funny characters wins the game.

Game #2: A player can divide the three types of cards into three piles for a solitaire version players where the sole player reveals a "head" card followed by a "body" card followed by a "legs" card, creating various funny-looking circus figures.

Game #3: A player can place the cards in numerical order to create a "flip-movie" by riffling the top of the deck with his or her thumb. (It might be noted that these different numbers and pictures on the backs of the cards could be used essentially as "marked cards" for the 3 to 4 player game.)

21132.name: Hastings 14 Ottobre 1066
21132.description:
One of the only two tactical wargames produced by the New Deal company. Italian language.

The Battle of Hastings is one of the few truly decisive battles in history. On a single day Duke William of Normandy conquered a kingdom that had resisted Viking invasions for years on end, ending a line of Anglo-Saxon kings that claim decent from Alfred the Great. This conquest altered the whole outlook of England, taking a nation that had looked towards Scandinavia, especially under three Danish kings, and locking her into a partnership and a struggle with France that was to last for centuries.

21133.description:
One hundred and seventy-five years into the future - Humanity has managed to survive despite itself, but for how much longer?

Infinity is a game with 28mm high metal miniatures that simulates combat and special operations in a science fiction environment with Manga aesthetics.

The Great Powers in conflict are: PanOceania, the Superpower: Leadership & Technology. Yu Jing, the Asian Power: Modernity & Tradition. Haqqislam, the New Islam: Wisdom & Bravery. Ariadna, the Lost Colony: Resistance & Tenacity. Nomads, the Nonconformists: Rebellion & Resourcefulness. The Combined Army, the Alien Threat: Power from Deep Space. Mercenaries, the Profession of War.

The Infinity game system is fast, spectacularly realistic and offers enormous tactical flexibility.

INFINITY uses a new and dynamic system that allows both players to be active during each turn.

Choose your army, select the best men and women to form your elite combat group, the mission vital, the hour has come!
21133.name: Infinity

21134.name: Schwingmurmel
21134.description: Swinging Marbles has players trying to getting small marbles from one cup to another. The cups are on lengths of wire, 80cm lengths! Plug the wires into the base board and try to swing the marbles from one cup to another. It does what it says on the tin!

21135.name: Coopetition: On the Go!
21135.description: An offshoot of the original Coopetition game, the On the Go! edition has players competing and cooperating in the categories Act, Talk, and Draw.
